0lam Employee Share Option Scheme

The Olam Employee Share Option Scheme (‘the ESOS’) was approved by the shareholders on 4 January 2005 at the Extraordinary General Meeting of the Company. The ESOS Rules were amended on 29 October 2008 at the Extraordinary General Meeting of the Company Under the amended rules, the directors (including Non-Executive directors and Independent directors) and employees of the Group are eligible to participate in the E808, and all subsequent options issued to the Group's employees and Executive directors shall have a life of ten years instead of ﬁve. For options granted to the Company’s Non-Executive directors and independent directors, the option period shall be no longer than five years. Controlling Shareholders and associates of

Controlling Shareholders are not eligible to participate in the E808.

The ESOS has expired on

3 January 2015. The terms of the E808 continue to apply to outstanding options granted under the E808. The ESOS rules amended on 29 October 2008 may be read in the Appendix 1 of the Company’s circular dated 13 October 2008.
